column3: is a municipality and taluk in Mandya District in the Indian state of Karnataka.

column1: Krishnarajpet is located at 12.66°N 76.49°E﻿ / 12.66; 76.49. It has an average elevation of 790 metres (2591 feet).

column3: 473. Males constitute 51% of the population and females 49%. Krishnarajpet has an average literacy rate of 70%

column5: and female literacy is 63%. In Krishnarajpet

column1: Manchibeedu eashwara temple(ಮಂಚಿಬೀಡು ಈಶ್ವರ ದೇವಸ್ಥಾನ) ಮಂಚಿಬೀಡು ಇತಿಹಾಸ.ಮಂಚಿಬೀಡು ಇತಿಹಾಸ
K R Pet and its surrounds have many ancient temples of architectural importance
One such small temple is the Hoysaleswara Temple at Thenginaghatta village. The temple is surrounded by wild bushes and banana plantations. Sadly neglected
column2: ancient sculptures are strewn about amidst debris. The epigraph reveals the name of the temple as ‘Hoysaleswara Temple’ and being completed on 7 August 1133 AD
column3: during the reign of the Hoysala king Narasimha. Further the inscription acknowledges Hadacala Kavanna
column6: Chikkate and Heggade Munjayya who had contributed towards the construction of the temple and a tank. Further it records the gifts of land made to sculptor of temple Bammoja

column1: Krishnarajpet is connected by good road and it can be reached easily within 3 hours from Bengaluru. The place can be reached in following ways
It can be reached from mandya by two way
It can be reached to bangalore by 3 ways
It can be reached from mysore with in 1 hour.
It can be reached by 3 different roads from mysore
